y = int(input())
if (y - 2018) % 26 == 0 or (y - 2018) % 26 == 1:
    print('yes')
else:
    print('no')


Explanation:
The optimal launch windows occur every 26 months. If the difference between the current year and 2018 is divisible by 26, or is one less than a multiple of 26, then there is an optimal launch window. The '%' operator is used to get the remainder of the division, which is 0 if the difference is a multiple of 26, and 1 if it is one less than a multiple of 26.

print("yes" if int(input()) % 26 in [4, 7, 10, 13] else "no")


Explanation:
The optimal launch windows occur in April, July, October, and January. So, the months that are divisible by 26 are April (4th month), July (7th month), October (10th month), and January (13th month). We check if the input year is divisible by 26 and if the remainder is in the list [4, 7, 10, 13]. If it is, we print "yes", otherwise "no".

Note: The months are 0-indexed, so the 4th month is actually the 3rd month

print("yes" if int(input()) % 26 == 4 else "no")


This python code checks if the year entered is divisible by 26 and if the remainder is 4. If it is, it prints "yes" meaning there is an optimal launch window in that year, if not it prints "no".

This works because the optimal launch window is in April, which is the 4th month, so the remainder of the year when divided by 26 gives us the month of the year. If the remainder is 4, that means the optimal launch window happens in April.

This code assumes that the months of the year are numbered from 0 to 11, with January being 0 and December being 11.

Since your rocket scientists apparently can not be bothered to tell you about the optimal launch windows before it is too late, you have to keep track of that yourself. Write a program that determines if there is an optimal launch window in any given year.

-----Output-----
Output “yes” if there is an optimal launch window in the year $y$, otherwise output “no”.

-----Examples-----
Sample Input 1:
2018
Sample Output 1:
yes

Sample Input 2:
2019
Sample Output 2:
no

Sample Input 3:
2020
Sample Output 3:
yes
